page.title: 01Ringmer _ An Introduction
page.content: Located in a clay vale on the Northern side of the South Downs. {Population approximately{4300.} Sited along main Lewes/Bexhill route and surrounded by farmland. Village has an hourly bus service. An infant, junior and com- prehensive school share a campus. The latter includes recently completed community swimming pool. Shopping centre in Springett Avenue. Nearby Village Hall, centre for various groups and societies including the parish council.{The Village Green,} facing the Lewes Road, is used for cricket, stoolball, fetes, etc.A {Norman Church}(St. Mary the Virgin) lies to one side of the green. The village has two garages, three public houses, a building works, forge, police house and a home for elderly residents. The name Ringmer means ring or pool of water.
